page.title: 05 HOUSING IN LITCHAM
page.content: Many of the older houses in this area are built of flint.This is because flint is found in abundance around here.There are 2 different methods of building with flint.They are knaped and unknaped.The knaped flint has it's edges cut off neatly in a square shape,the unknaped flint is just flint from the ground. The biggest flint building in Litcham is the church built in the C16.The next biggest building is the priory which is now a cafe,built in C15.As well as houses having walls,they need roofs.Some houses in Litcham have slate roofs but the majority have red pan tiles because they are cheaper than slate.
